title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design
Interview Descriptions: First, the PI asked me questions regarding the theories of the algorithms often used in our field. Then, he wanted to know my motivation to research in this field. Finally, PI requested me to implement an algorithm and send it to him once I completed it.
Interview Questions: How did supporting vector machines do classification? Why did you want to be an RA?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was distracted and not listening to the interviewee. Jumped from 1 topic to another. Did not follow up in answers given. Although intervieww had exoerience in all the areas that interviewer was asking.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and what you know about us?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design
Interview Descriptions: It was well organized interview with four interviewers and the decision came out very quick. The interview took around one hours with questions regarding backgrounds, interests, and capabilities for the position.
Interview Questions: What skills and knowledge can you bring to the project?

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a relatively straightforward process where the professors in charge of the lab interviewed your interest and what you want out of the internship. No difficult questions were asked and it felt more like a conversation.
Interview Questions: What do you want to get out of this internship?

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore)
Interview Descriptions:
Zoom meetings for 1st and 2nd round. Round 1 with reporting officer, round 2 with the boss of the reporting officer.  Both sessions were 1 to 1 interviews. After clearing round 1, before round 2, HR asked for payslips, certificates and contacts of 2 referees. I gave them the contacts of 2 ex-bosses and they sent them a form to fill in.  One of them showed me the form, it was a 1.5 page questionnaire with 11 open ended questions. I think my ex-bosses spent a bit of effort to complete the form. 
I enquired with them 1 mth later and they say they have moved forward with another candidate.

I am ok about not getting the job but I wonder if they could have asked my referees to fill in the form only AFTER the second interview when they have more or less decided if they wanted to offer me the job so that my exbosses do not have to waste their time. 

I actually feel worst abt wasting my exbosses time than not getting the job offer.
Interview Questions: What time do you knock off at your current job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design
Interview Descriptions: Long interview with meaningful discussions on portfolio, scope of work, specialization and work culture. Interviewers were friendly but professional and the HRs involved in the hiring process are very efficient and responsive.
Interview Questions: Application of specialized research in their field of study.

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was good. It was conducted online on zoom. The interviewer was respectful and asked fair questions. And also they answered all of my questions and queries moving forward.
Interview Questions: about research work and current experience

title: Senior Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was done via zoom for a covering role. Short and sweet. Smooth process but was only notified at least 4 weeks later. The hiring manager was able to make the decision soon but the paperwork took time.
Interview Questions: What was my previous role like? What are my career expectations?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design
Interview Descriptions: A really quick phone call interview to learn about my experiences. Did not really ask much questions. Also had to submit essays that I've written in the past as proof of my language literacy.
Interview Questions: Asked about my language literacy

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design
Interview Descriptions: Did an online interview with their leadership team. The head honcho did all the talking from beginning to end. Right off the bat, he/they struck me as *extremely* rude, i.e., it was a one-way video call, as in he/they could see me but I couldn't see him/them. Asked plenty of questions about teaching even though the position was a combination of research and teaching. It did not seem like they were at all interested in my profile, so it was baffling as to why I was called to interview. Browsing through their various department/division websites, it seems like the Singaporean core at SUTD is not particularly strong, especially in terms of professorial staff.
Interview Questions: General questions. None of a technical nature.

title: Scholarship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied for SUTD in Dec 20' through SSA (Special Scholarship Arrangement) with JC prelim results. Interview conducted on Zoom. Entered the waiting room, waited for about 10 mins and started the interview which was 1-on-1 with upper management. The interview took about 25-30 mins.. Waited about 1.5 months to receive the offer.
Interview Questions:
Why did you pick SUTD?
Do you prefer hands-on learning or predominantly through lectures?

title: Web Content Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore)
Interview Descriptions: It was for a pioneer position over in SUTD. The hiring agency called me up for an interview where there will be the HR and 4 other interviewers - they were from the 4 pillars in SUTD. The people were friendly and asked me questions relating to what I had done previously and about myself.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself and what you are currently doing?

title: PhD Studentship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: 40 minutes interview, the interviewers were not tough, the questions were easy and relaxed. I asked many questions in the end of the interview. It is depends on which interviewer you met, and I heard some of my colleagues that the interviewers they met were tough.
Interview Questions: Why do you choose this program?

title: Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is OK. It did not take a long time to process. The job was based on projects, so only interviewed by PI. There were not so many questions, because it really depends on the expertise/experience, etc.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate (STEP) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design
Interview Descriptions: The interview was done in groups of 3 with a faculty. The faculty you were interviewed by depends on what programme you were applying for (ie STEP, DDP or none of those). A question will be asked, then students will answer one by one.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was seamless without any complications. Interviewer was outgoing and friendly. Although he had many applicants, he made sure he talked to each as if they are the first.
Interview Questions: What are your research experiences? Tell me what are you interested in?

title: Senior Associate/Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: One round with hiring managers from department.  Relatively okay interview, interviewers were friendly and answered queries I had. Only 1 round face to face, followed by offer over the phone.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at SUTD

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design
Interview Descriptions: Nothing special . Just normal without any new method nor any challenge . Was quite a few years back .. cannot recall I'm details . Many years ago things were simple
Interview Questions: Cannot recall. Normal stuff like why you leave and what are goals..also essay questions were given. Things were quite easy going in earlier years  with no panel to interview

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Interview was conducted over two rounds. Both rounds with the same interviewers and this allowed for a thorough discussion about the role and responsibilities.

Interview was conducted with the research team and director.
Interview Questions:
Background
Research experience
Skills and competencies
Ideas and suggestions for the project (related to the role)

title: Senior Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was straightforward, submit your application and within 2 weeks was contacted and came down for an interview. The first interview was with the hiring manager. After 1 week, there was another interview with the HOD.
Interview Questions: Tell me how your previous job experiences are relevant to this role?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions:
The first day, seminar talk to students; meeting some faculty members; dinner with faculty members; visit some labs.
The second day, an interview from pillar heads and the president (more important).
They will have a conclusion right after your interview (in 3 days) if you have the offer.
Interview Questions:
Why do you choose SUTD? 
What's your understanding of design? 
What's the usage of your techniques?
Who in the department can you collaborate with?
Where can you get funding?
What's your teaching experience?

title: Undergraduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Shortlisting after that an interview. I got no questions on science or math, just was asked about my past work, aspirations etc. Interviewers were friendly and encouraged discussion and very well informed about the university
Interview Questions: What are some of your past projects?

title: Sponsorship Grant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: When asked what is the culture of the organisation is like, the interviewer responded by saying that it is a very subjective question and (s)he cannot answer as it is very personal. No need to mention further how the interview went with the interviewer giving such response.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to leave your current company?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
* Video interview
* On-Site Interview with management
Questions related to job functions and company profile. They shared what they require from candidate. 
Questions asked were those listed in job descriptions, just come prepared.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to leave your current job?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very brief, talked for half hour and we discussed about the project and my previous papers. It was very casual. Later I was asked to read some related papers and was asked to present my understanding.
Interview Questions: Why do u want to work on the mentioned topic?

title: Manager/Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore)
Interview Descriptions:
It was obvious that the interview was just a formality. They probably had already found a suitable candidate earlier but did not want to cancel mine, which was unfair as they should assess all candidates 1st before making a decision. 

1st, the Head of the unit who was supposed to be there didnt turn up. Only 2 of his subordinates did.

2nd, they didnt show interest in my resume at all. It was abvious they had not read it. They also asked obvious questions with answers that could have been found in my resume like 'Where did you work last and what did you do there?'.

With the lack of interest and preparation from and by the interviewers, the interview understandably lasted only 10 mins, which is the shortest interview I ever had.

This episode really shows the lack of integrity and sincerity of SUTD's decision makers. I spent more than a week preparing for it. Either cancel it or give me a fair chance!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore)
Interview Descriptions: I met directly with the professor for an informal interview as I was a graduate from SUTD. It was direct and more of a sharing of interest and mutual understanding.
Interview Questions: what was your research interest

title: Digital Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer highlighted right off the bat about my lack of experience, which I thought was dodgy B.S. - fair enough the candidacy criteria requires some number of years (which wasn't mentioned in SUTD's job posting), but they could have filtered me after reading the CV and not waste my time. I had the dignity to call off the interview in the first 20 seconds and walked away.
Interview Questions: Do you know you're too junior for this role? (to which the job posting did not mention number of years experience required, and for the record, I had 4 years of digital experience - potentially enough for a managerial role)

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: what are the areas of strength and weakness that you have. Why do you want to leave your current job and move? What do you see in yourself doing in the next 5 years? what are the areas you are interested to improve in?
Interview Questions: what are the areas of strength and weakness that you have. Why do you want to leave your current job and move? What do you see in yourself doing in the next 5 years? what are the areas you are interested to improve in?

title: Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: First interview through appointed Employment agency which fill in details of the job description. Second interview with SUTD HR manager that relate the job description different from Employment agency. Third interview with SUTD HR manager and 2 PA which additional job description that wasn't told earlier in first and second interview.
Interview Questions: You have to buy lunches or snack boxes and carry out short term notice

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: HR was quick and detailed, They were also courteous and accommodating. Questions from the direct supervisor were quite specific to job function. It was a smooth process despite me being busy with family matters.
Interview Questions: What skills do you have to effective contribute to the institution?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design (Singapore) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Interview with the Lab Director who was highly qualifies professional and soft spoken.
ALl the panel members were quite professional and took time in understanding and analysing my potential to the best and tried helping me improve my weaknessess.
Interview Questions: How could you contribute to the Architecture through computation and tell me why have you chosen this lab when there's a lot of scope in our European and American counterparts?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Singapore University of Technology and Design
Interview Descriptions:
I contacted a postdoc first. He inverviewed me and then recommended to the professor. Then professor and I had an interview through Skype. After agreement, HR contacted me for documents.
The interview was about projects I participated in and I was asked to described about them.
Interview Questions: N/A
